page.title: 03Buildings
page.content: Most of the houses were built in red coloured bricks probably from the old brickworks in the next village,Cubley.The newest building is a bungalow 1 year old.There are 14 Council houses opposite the school built in 1964.On one red brick farm there is a corrugated asbestos roof .It dates from 1925 when you could not get slates after the 1st World War.The house has windows blocked up for the 18thC window tax.The shelter, now a bus stop,is dated 1897 and once sheltered the pump.The school dates from 1872.The timbered Manor House dates from 1790 and is now a racing stable.The old village bakery and post office was in one of the outbuildings. Interesting old buildings include 4 ex-pubs.The present pub may have been a brewhouse.There was also a malthouse a blacksmith and a creamery.
